slug: /210
title: "This Week In React #210: React 19 pre-warming, Next.js, IDE, TanStack, React Scan, MistCSS, PayloadCMS, Expo Workflows, Universal RSC, use dom, Yoga JSI, Skia, Turbo Haptics, TV, FastIO, SwiftUI, Angular 19..."
authors: [matthieugicquel, cyrilbo]

---

segments.source_content: Big news from the React world this week! React 19 is back in RC, six months after its initial release was postponed. The suspense over Suspense is finally easing with the introduction of pre-warming.

translations.fr: Grande nouvelle du monde React cette semaine ! React 19 est de retour en RC, six mois aprÃ¨s le report de sa sortie initiale. Le suspense autour de Suspense s'attÃ©nue enfin avec l'introduction du prÃ©chauffage.

segments.source_content: Handsontable is [a feature-rich data grid](https://handsontable.com/demo?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=twirnov20) designed for React developers who need a powerful, customizable, and accessible solution to manage complex data.

segments.source_content:
- A unique **spreadsheet-like interface** with sorting, filtering, and CRUD operations
- Advanced operations like conditional formatting and **400 built-in formulas**, similar to Excel
- **Customizable editors and renderers**, allowing dropdowns, menus or custom components within grid cells to fit specific use cases
- **Optimized performance** for smooth and responsive interactions
- **Accessibility with WCAG 2.1 compliance** for better support for users with disabilities

- **Performance optimisÃ©e** pour des interactions fluides et rÃ©actives
- **AccessibilitÃ© avec conformitÃ© WCAG 2.1** pour une meilleure prise en charge des utilisateurs en situation de handicap

- Une **interface type tableur** unique avec tri, filtrage et opÃ©rations CRUD

segments.source_content: [**React 19 RC1 - Siblings pre-warming**](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/29898#issuecomment-2477449973)

translations.fr: [**React 19 RC1 - PrÃ©chargement des composants frÃ¨res**](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/29898#issuecomment-2477449973)
translations.en: [**React 19 RC1 - PrÃ©chargement des composants frÃ¨res**](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/29898#issuecomment-2477449973)

segments.source_content:
Weâ€™ve covered how the initial release of React 19 was aborted because of a change in Suspense that would have caused waterfalls in apps that use Suspense without starting fetches in event handlers.  
The React team has been hard at work to reintroduce Suspense sibling prerendering without causing performance regressions for apps that start fetching early. Their solution is now ready and itâ€™s called [pre-warming](https://react.dev/blog/2024/04/25/react-19-upgrade-guide#improvements-to-suspense). Dominik, the React Query maintainer who raised awareness of this problem, [has confirmed heâ€™s happy with the fix](https://bsky.app/profile/tkdodo.eu/post/3layw6wk5bs2b).  
As usual, the new features were already available in Next.JS (which uses react canary). They include server components and actions, the new `use` hook, improvements to forms handling (`useFormStatus` and `useOptimistic`), and a small but long-awaited change: `forwardRef` is not necessary anymore!

translations.fr:
Nous avions expliquÃ© comment la sortie initiale de React 19 avait Ã©tÃ© annulÃ©e Ã  cause d'un changement dans Suspense qui aurait provoquÃ© des cascades de chargement dans les applications utilisant Suspense sans dÃ©marrer les rÃ©cupÃ©rations de donnÃ©es dans les gestionnaires d'Ã©vÃ©nements.  
L'Ã©quipe React a travaillÃ© dur pour rÃ©introduire le prÃ©rendu des composants frÃ¨res avec Suspense sans causer de rÃ©gressions de performances pour les applications qui dÃ©marrent les rÃ©cupÃ©rations tÃ´t. Leur solution est maintenant prÃªte et s'appelle le [prÃ©chargement (pre-warming)](https://react.dev/blog/2024/04/25/react-19-upgrade-guide#improvements-to-suspense). Dominik, le mainteneur de React Query qui avait alertÃ© sur ce problÃ¨me, [a confirmÃ© Ãªtre satisfait du correctif](https://bsky.app/profile/tkdodo.eu/post/3layw6wk5bs2b).  
Comme d'habitude, les nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s Ã©taient dÃ©jÃ  disponibles dans Next.JS (qui utilise la version canary de React). Elles incluent les composants serveur et les actions, le nouveau hook `use`, des amÃ©liorations pour la gestion des formulaires (`useFormStatus` et `useOptimistic`), et un petit changement longtemps attendu : `forwardRef` n'est plus nÃ©cessaire !
translations.en:
Nous avions expliquÃ© comment la sortie initiale de React 19 avait Ã©tÃ© annulÃ©e Ã  cause d'un changement dans Suspense qui aurait provoquÃ© des cascades dans les applications utilisant Suspense sans dÃ©marrer les rÃ©cupÃ©rations dans les gestionnaires d'Ã©vÃ©nements.  
L'Ã©quipe React a travaillÃ© dur pour rÃ©introduire le prÃ©rendu des composants frÃ¨res avec Suspense sans provoquer de rÃ©gressions de performance pour les applications qui dÃ©marrent tÃ´t leurs rÃ©cupÃ©rations. Leur solution est maintenant prÃªte et s'appelle le [prÃ©chargement](https://react.dev/blog/2024/04/25/react-19-upgrade-guide#improvements-to-suspense). Dominik, le mainteneur de React Query qui avait alertÃ© sur ce problÃ¨me, [a confirmÃ© sa satisfaction concernant le correctif](https://bsky.app/profile/tkdodo.eu/post/3layw6wk5bs2b).  
Comme d'habitude, les nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s Ã©taient dÃ©jÃ  disponibles dans Next.JS (qui utilise React Canary). Elles incluent les composants et actions serveur, le nouveau hook `use`, des amÃ©liorations dans la gestion des formulaires (`useFormStatus` et `useOptimistic`), et un petit changement longtemps attendu : `forwardRef` n'est plus nÃ©cessaire !

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Omlet â€“ Scan your repo and measure how and where React components are used](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-nov-2024)
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js segment cache initial implementation](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/72875): A rewrite of App Router's client caching implementation, designed with PPR and "use cache" in mind. Not production-ready at all, but in the future Next will cache by route segment instead of by full URL.
- ğŸ‘€ [React Query may soon have a unified staleTime per query](https://github.com/TanStack/query/pull/8313) instead of one per â€œobserverâ€ (e.g. each `useQuery`). This will be less flexible but certainly easier to reason about.
- ğŸ‘€ [React IDE](https://youtu.be/C8Mg-NSyqWg?t=14452): Mofei (React Compiler team) unveils at React Summit the plan to work on a VSCode extension powered by the compiler. Don't get too excited, because we don't know much about it yet!
- ğŸ‘€ [TanStack Start is officially in beta](https://bsky.app/profile/tannerlinsley.com/post/3lbdl4zp2ns2n)
- ğŸ“– [The Road to Next](https://www.road-to-next.com/): Robin Wieruch launched his paid Next.js 15 course with early access discounts.
- ğŸ—“ï¸ [React Day Berlin](https://reactday.berlin/?utm_source=Newsletter&utm_medium=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª Berlin - 13 & 16 December - Hurry and grab your ticket to the conference as prices are about to go up! And donâ€™t forget your discount with code â€œTWIRâ€.
- ğŸ“œ [Essential Typescript for React](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/react-ts): A concise article on the most valuable tips to be productive.
- ğŸ“œ [Be careful with useSyncExternalStore](https://www.nico.fyi/blog/be-careful-with-usesyncexternalstore): implementation of a `useLocalStorage` hook using `useSyncExternalStore` and `superjson`.
- ğŸ“œ [5 differences between React server components and server-side rendering](https://www.tymzap.com/blog/5-differences-between-react-server-components-and-server-side-rendering): At this point you already know that they are not at all the same. This recaps the concrete differences between the two.
- ğŸ“œ [Design System: from scratch or from the shelf?](https://www.voorhoede.nl/en/blog/design-system-from-scratch-from-the-shelf/)
- ğŸ“œ [What are React Portals?](https://techhub.iodigital.com/articles/what-are-react-portals)
- ğŸ“œ [Creating your own React design system analytics tool with react-scanner](https://alexocallaghan.com/creating-your-own-react-design-system-analytics-tool)
- ğŸ“œ [Quick Guide to Building a PWA with Next.js](https://playfulprogramming.com/posts/pwa-nextjs-guide)
- ğŸ“œ [Vercel - Skew Protection is now enabled by default for new projects](https://vercel.com/changelog/skew-protection-is-now-enabled-by-default-for-new-projects)
- ğŸ“œ [React Anti-Pattern: Stop Passing Setters Down the Components Tree](https://matanbobi.dev/posts/stop-passing-setter-functions-to-components)
- ğŸ“¦ [react-scan](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan): The MillionJS team released a new tool to find performance issues (re-renders) in React apps.
- ğŸ“¦ [PayloadCMS 3.0 \- Seamless integration with Next.js app router](https://github.com/payloadcms/payload/releases/tag/v3.0.0): The CMS can now run seamlessly within your existing Next.js app, exposing a `withPayload()` plugin.
- ğŸ“¦ [MistCSS 1.0](https://github.com/typicode/mistcss): Instead of generating full React components from CSS, the library now bets on generating types to enhance intrinsic React JSX elements. Interesting idea!
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington - â€œuse cacheâ€ NextJSâ€™s latest take on data caching](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZDRGEewXkrs)
- ğŸ¥ [Theo - How To Avoid Big Serverless Bills](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jsuNjCAngnQ): Various tips for Vercel or Next.js users.

segments.source_content: [![Expo Workflows](/emails/issues/210/workflows.jpg)](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-workflows-automate-your-release-process)

translations.fr: [![Expo Workflows](/emails/issues/210/workflows.jpg)](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-workflows-automate-your-release-process)
translations.en: [![Expo Workflows](/emails/issues/210/workflows.jpg)](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-workflows-automate-your-release-process)

segments.source_content:
[**Expo Workflows**](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-workflows-automate-your-release-process)
Expo has announced "Workflows," a new CI/CD tool for React Native and Expo apps that simplifies and accelerates app releases with pre-packaged jobs (such as E2E tests using Maestro), automated workflows, and smart machine selection for optimal performance. While itâ€™s not a direct replacement for more general CI/CD solutions like GitHub Actions, it promises exciting improvements worth exploring.

translations.fr:
[**Expo Workflows**](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-workflows-automate-your-release-process)
Expo a annoncÃ© "Workflows", un nouvel outil CI/CD pour les applications React Native et Expo qui simplifie et accÃ©lÃ¨re les publications d'apps avec des jobs prÃ©-packagÃ©s (comme des tests E2E utilisant Maestro), des workflows automatisÃ©s et une sÃ©lection intelligente de machines pour des performances optimales. Bien que ce ne soit pas un remplacement direct des solutions CI/CD plus gÃ©nÃ©rales comme GitHub Actions, il promet des amÃ©liorations passionnantes Ã  explorer.
translations.en:
[**Expo Workflows**](https://expo.dev/blog/expo-workflows-automate-your-release-process)
Expo a annoncÃ© "Workflows", un nouvel outil CI/CD pour les apps React Native et Expo qui simplifie et accÃ©lÃ¨re les publications avec des tÃ¢ches prÃ©configurÃ©es (comme les tests E2E via Maestro), des workflows automatisÃ©s et une sÃ©lection intelligente de machines pour des performances optimales. Bien que ce ne soit pas un remplacement direct des solutions CI/CD plus gÃ©nÃ©rales comme GitHub Actions, il promet des amÃ©liorations passionnantes Ã  explorer.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“£ [Expo \- Introducing Channel Pausing for EAS Update : Pause your channels either on the web page or via the eas cli](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/11-14-channel-pausing)
- ğŸ“œ [Universal React Server Components in Expo Router (in beta)](https://expo.dev/blog/universal-react-server-components-developer-preview): Expo Router introduces for the first time universal React Server Components, enabling server-side rendering in both native and web apps. Though not production-ready due to unavailable production exports and mainly aimed at library authors, it's an exciting development because it enables direct server-side access to resources like secrets, databases, and file systems, simplifying development and improving performance by eliminating client-server round trips.
- ğŸ“œ [The magic of Expo DOM Components](https://expo.dev/blog/the-magic-of-expo-dom-components): Expo DOM Components make it easier to integrate web features into React Native apps, combining the speed of WebViews with incremental native migration. While limited by WebView performance and compatibility with some Expo features, future updates aim to enhance native integration and optimize performance.

translations.fr:
- ğŸ“£ [Expo - PrÃ©sentation de la mise en pause des canaux pour EAS Update : Mettez vos canaux en pause via la page web ou la CLI eas](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/11-14-channel-pausing)
- ğŸ“œ [Composants serveur React universels dans Expo Router (en bÃªta)](https://expo.dev/blog/universal-react-server-components-developer-preview) : Expo Router introduit pour la premiÃ¨re fois des composants serveur React universels, permettant le rendu cÃ´tÃ© serveur dans les applications natives et web. Bien que non prÃªt pour la production en raison de l'indisponibilitÃ© des exports de production et principalement destinÃ© aux auteurs de bibliothÃ¨ques, c'est un dÃ©veloppement passionnant car il permet un accÃ¨s direct cÃ´tÃ© serveur Ã  des ressources comme les secrets, les bases de donnÃ©es et les systÃ¨mes de fichiers, simplifiant le dÃ©veloppement et amÃ©liorant les performances en Ã©liminant les allers-retours client-serveur.
- ğŸ“œ [La magie des composants DOM d'Expo](https://expo.dev/blog/the-magic-of-expo-dom-components) : Les composants DOM d'Expo facilitent l'intÃ©gration de fonctionnalitÃ©s web dans les applications React Native, en combinant la rapiditÃ© des WebViews avec une migration native progressive. Bien que limitÃ©s par les performances des WebViews et la compatibilitÃ© avec certaines fonctionnalitÃ©s d'Expo, les futures mises Ã  jour visent Ã  amÃ©liorer l'intÃ©gration native et Ã  optimiser les performances.

en.translation: - ğŸ“£ [Expo - PrÃ©sentation de la mise en pause de canaux pour EAS Update : Mettez vos canaux en pause soit via la page web, soit via l'interface CLI eas](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/11-14-channel-pausing)
